section: Chase will evaluate your registration form and will notify you via e-mail of the acceptance or rejection of your registration form. Chase reserves, in its sole discretion, with or without reason, the right to accept or reject your registration into the Chase Affiliate Program, including but not limited to a determination that your site is unsuitable for or incompatible with the Affiliate Program based on the following criteria (collectively Restricted Content)
explanation: The phrase 'with or without reason' grants Chase the right to reject applications arbitrarily, undermining the purpose of the listed criteria for rejection. This lack of constraint creates ambiguity as to what standards applicants must meet and allows for potentially discriminatory or unfair decisions.

section: Affiliates who use this program to apply for credit cards for their own use are NOT in violation of this Agreement.
explanation: This appears to contradict the earlier statement in Section 13, 'This program is intended for commercial use only'. While it clarifies that affiliates aren't penalized for personal use, it creates an inconsistency. It is not clear if the 'commercial use only' clause has any meaning.

section: Chase reserves the right to change any and all of the terms and conditions in this Agreement, at any time and in its sole discretion, by posting a new agreement on its Website.
explanation: This clause grants Chase unilateral power to modify the agreement without requiring explicit consent from the affiliate, which raises concerns about fairness and enforceability. This could potentially allow Chase to impose unfavorable conditions on affiliates retroactively.
